data.question: What is the molecular weight of the compound [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2)?
What crystal system does the compound [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3) belong to?
What is the space group of the compound [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2)?
What is the density (ρ) of the compound [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3)?
What is the maximum theta (θ max) angle during the X-ray crystallographic data collection for [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2)?
What is the temperature at which the X-ray analysis was performed for both compounds [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2) and [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3)?
Based on the synthesis conditions, which solvent was used for refluxing the mixture of CdCl2*H2O and ligand 1 to synthesize [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2)?
Considering the synthesis of [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3), what was the yield percentage after refluxing CdBr2 and ligand 1 in MeOH?
What is the relationship between the solubility of [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2) in CH3CN and its ability to form crystals suitable for X-ray analysis?
data.answer: Despite being sparingly soluble in CH3CN, crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained by diffusion of Et2O into a solution of the compound in CH3CN.

data.question: How does the change in halogen (from Cl to Br) affect the molecular weight and density of the compounds [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2) and [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3)?
data.answer: The change from Cl to Br increases both the molecular weight (from 824.24 to 1001.94) and the density (from 1.783 g cm-1 to 2.018 g cm-1).

data.question: Is the crystal system of [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2) monoclinic?
Is the space group of [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3) P21?
Does the compound [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2) have a higher molecular weight than [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3)?
Is the density of [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2) greater than 2 g cm-1?
Was the synthesis of [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2) and [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3) performed at a temperature of 173(1) K?
Is the absolute structure parameter for [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2) positive?
Does the compound [Cd(1)Br4Cd] (3) exhibit a higher solubility in CH3CN compared to [Cd(1)Cl4Cd] (2)?
